resources.string: You have new pictures in PhotoGallery.

For students from other universities, please be noted that this doesn’t mean iCog has shut its door, rather your application will go through a further process and depending on available spots, you can also be accepted.

Current Apprenticeship Openings
 Unless there is an update on a special need, the following list of apprenticeship programs are what iCog offers and these are always open to the eligible candidates.
 Advanced Computer programing
 Artificial Intelligence
 Computational Linguistics
 Bioinformatics
 Human Machine Interface
 Robotics
 3D Animation and Virtual Reality Modeling
 Who are the eligible candidates?
 For Undergraduate Students, iCog’s Apprenticeship program is open only for students of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science students
 For Graduate Students, iCog will accept students who are studying computer science related fields.

N.B iCog has more than 20 partner universities and because of the sheer number of students applying of our internship program, we will only accept candidates from the following Ethiopian universities which have the priority based on their UIL performance with our company.

The iCog-Labs’s Student Apprenticeship Program offers substantive, practical work-learning experiences to undergraduate and graduate students at Addis Ababa University and other local and abroad universities. Through this practical UCSD work-learning experience, students have the flexibility to explore career options while gaining exposure to valuable international networks and developing first-rate skills in Artificial Intelligence Development, Computer Programing, Robotics, Machine Interface, Bio-Informatics, Computer Algorithm and 3D Animations and Virtual Reality Modeling. iCog also serves as a career-development resource for students after they have completed their apprenticeships, assisting with job interviews, recommendations and related affairs. Training and mentoring students is an opportunity to collaborate with a diverse group of personnel—a group representing the workforce of the future and who play a key role in the successful planning of iCog’s growth and development.
WE ACCEPT APPLICATIONS ANYTIME OF THE YEAR

iCog Labs is a research and development company based in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, collaborating with international AI research groups and serving customers around the world. We have helped our customers with a variety of projects, but our core specialty is artificial intelligence, including machine learning based data analysis, computational linguistics, computer vision, mobile robots and cognitive robotics, cognitive architectures and artificial general intelligence. Our staffs bring experience contributing to international AI development teams, as well as software and hardware development experience on Ethiopian government and industry projects. We are core contributors to the OpenCog open source AI platform and utilize OpenCog within our projects as appropriate. \n\n Our mission is to advance science and technology for the good of all humanity, with a special focus on advanced AI and on the use of cutting-edge technology to help leapfrog Africa into the future.
Recommendations for people to contact based on your message history

iCog incorporated some of its previous project ideas and resources and came up with SOLVE IT an innovation completion in selected cities of the country; capitalizing on the idea that the involvement of regional cities is crucial if one wants to create a sustainable local tech market. With such spirit, SOLVE IT was proposed to the US embassy in Addis Ababa. The first round of SOLVE IT, as a result, was conducted in collaboration with the US embassy (From November 30, 2017- September 25, 2018). \n\nThe project sparked and created awareness about the impact of pro-poor technologies via direct seminars, media coverage, marketing collateral. And finally, it delivered a grand finale where the top three projects were selected in the national competition by mobilizing the top three projects, from each city, represented by one or two team members, for a week-long boot camp training before the national competition. In the boot camp the participants got the chance of to visit Ethiopian airlines, ENSA and other technology places. In the bootcamp the participants got a chance to meet and show their project to investors at the end they presented their respective pitch for competition judges.
